prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Merge annotation data and gene expression tables and calculate number of columns.

response:
To merge the annotation data and gene expression tables and calculate the number of columns, we will use the R programming language. Here are the steps to follow:

Step 1: Load the required libraries
```
library(readxl)
library(data.table)
```

Step 2: Read the count table and annotation data
```
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")
annotation_data <- fread("SRP021193.colData.tsv", sep="\t")
```

Step 3: Set the row names of the count table to be the gene names
```
rownames(count_table) <- count_table[,1]
```

Step 4: Merge the annotation data and count table using the sample IDs
```
merged_data <- merge(annotation_data, count_table, by.x = "sample ids", by.y = "Sample")
```

Step 5: Calculate the number of columns in the merged data
```
num_columns <- ncol(merged_data)
```

Here is the complete code:
```
library(readxl)
library(data.table)

count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")
annotation_data <- fread("SRP021193.colData.tsv", sep="\t")

rownames(count_table) <- count_table[,1]

merged_data <- merge(annotation_data, count_table, by.x = "sample ids", by.y = "Sample")

num_columns <- ncol(merged_data)
```

The variable `num_columns` will contain the number of columns in the merged data.
